Debits vs Credits Cheat Sheet📚 Grab my FREE accounting infographic ebook:🔗 →https://lnkd.in/geciS9nMIf you want to undersatnd accounting, you must know debits and credits work.Here's a simplified breakdown:Account Types and Their Normal Balances:💰 Assets: Debit (Increased by Debit, Decreased by Credit)💸 Expenses: Debit (Increased by Debit, Decreased by Credit)📈 Dividend: Debit (Increased by Debit, Decreased by Credit)📉 Losses: Debit (Increased by Debit, Decreased by Credit)📊 Liabilities: Credit (Increased by Credit, Decreased by Debit)💼 Capital: Credit (Increased by Credit, Decreased by Debit)💵 Revenue: Credit (Increased by Credit, Decreased by Debit)📈 Gains: Credit (Increased by Credit, Decreased by Debit)Key Points to Remember:• All Assets, Losses, and Expenditure accounts will have a Debit balance.• All Liabilities, Gains, and Revenues accounts will have a Credit balance.• All journal entries are placed in their respective ledger accounts.• The first step in accounting is to pass a Journal Entry for every transaction.• Some accounts will be debited and some will be credited.Example:In accounting, every transaction affects two accounts:• Business makes a sale of $700 in cash• Cash account is increased (debited) by $700.• Revenue account is increased (credited) by $700.FollowBrian Feroldifor more content like this.If you found this post useful, please repost ♻️ to share with your audience.…more

A highly functioning person can be suffering too.This great infographic from the team at the depression project gives some great insight on this important topic.We need to ensure that we reach out to all around us to check they okay, especially those who seem to have it together.  This is particularly important in the workplace.Internally, people with high-functioning depression have the symptoms of a depressive disorder, but can function well in various aspects of life, like work, school, home, and relationships. They have the ability to mask their depression, so others would never recognise it is present.The risk is that sufferers can believe that since they can push through their struggles for a period whilst still being able to achieve at work, that they do not need to seek help. But that’s a dangerous approach that will prevent the signs of worsening depression being identified.We hear it all the time about colleagues and friends we lose to mental health challenges. “I never knew he/she was suffering” “they were the life of the party”.Reach out to all those around you and if someone says they are okay, but something doesn’t seem right, just hang around a bit longer and talk a bit more and be there for them.As always being vulnerable yourself about your experiences can open the door for someone else to admit they are struggling too.hashtag#mentalhealthhashtag#wellbeinghashtag#depressionawarenesshashtag#linkedin…more

"AI should not replicate human flaws. It should challenge them."As business leaders and beginners venturing into the world of Artificial Intelligence, it's crucial to understand the significance of this quote. AI presents an opportunity not just to automate processes but to enhance them by eliminating biases and inefficiencies inherent in human decision-making.Consider recruitment, for example. Traditional hiring processes can be biased, influenced by unconscious preferences. AI can help create more inclusive work environments by focusing on skills and qualifications rather than subjective judgments. When designed thoughtfully, AI can identify the best candidates based on objective data, thus promoting diversity.In customer service, deploying AI can improve response times and accuracy, providing customers with quick and precise solutions. Unlike humans, AI doesn't get tired or frustrated, which ensures consistent service quality. However, to avoid replicating human flaws like misunderstanding context, AI systems need to be trained with diverse datasets that reflect varied customer interactions.Marketing is another area ripe for AI's transformative power. By analyzing consumer behavior, AI can help craft personalized experiences that resonate more deeply with target audiences. Yet, it's crucial to ensure that these AI systems are free from biases that might marginalize certain groups.To truly harness the potential of AI, we must develop systems that challenge our flawed processes and deliver improved outcomes. This requires a conscious effort to feed AI models with diverse, high-quality data and continuously monitor their outputs for unintended biases.As you begin integrating AI into your business, ask yourself: Is your AI setup challenging existing flaws, or is it inadvertently replicating them? The goal is not just to deploy AI but to do so with a strategic mindset that prioritizes fairness, efficiency, and innovation.P.S. "The ultimate test of AI is whether it makes our lives more human—not less."In the quest to integrate AI into business, it's crucial to focus on how technology amplifies the human element. AI should not only streamline operations but also enhance the emotional and creative aspects of work. For beginners, the goal should be to harness AI in ways that promote meaningful connections and nurture innovation.1. Personalization in Customer Experience: AI can analyze customer data to offer personalized experiences. Businesses can cultivate deeper relationships by tailoring products and services to individual preferences. This level of personalization makes interactions feel more human and genuine.2. Automating Routine Tasks: By automating repetitive tasks, AI frees up time for employees to engage in creative problem-solving and strategic thinking. This shift from mundane tasks to meaningful work enables employees to feel more fulfilled and motivated.3. Enhancing Decision-Making: AI can process vast amounts of data quickly, offering insights that inform better business decisions. While AI handles the data crunching, human intuition and empathy are essential for making decisions that consider the broader impact on people and society.4. Facilitating Communication: AI-driven tools can improve communication within a business, whether through chatbots that provide instant customer support or tools that facilitate collaboration across teams. By improving communication, AI helps build stronger, more connected teams.5. Supporting Inclusivity: AI can assist in creating more inclusive workplaces by identifying biases in recruitment processes and suggesting improvements. Ensuring diversity and inclusivity in AI applications reminds us that technology should serve all humans equally.As you explore AI for your business, keep in mind that the most successful implementations are those that enhance the human experience. AI should be a tool that complements and elevates our human capabilities rather than diminishes them.P.S.
